info.description:
# Introduction

Gem API is a [RESTful](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_state_transfer) API that
provides programmatic methods to access and modify data on the Gem platform. The API is hosted at
`https://api.gem.com` and follows standard REST practices.

Requests are made with standard HTTP methods (`GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`) to documented URI
endpoints with `application/json` content type.

Responses include standard HTTP response codes (`200`, `201`, `204`, `400`, `404`, etc) and JSON
encoded body, where applicable. Errors are also represented with a JSON object in the response body.

> **NOTE**: The Gem API is still in development mode. While stability and compatibility will be
> carefully maintained as much as possible, changes will likely be introduced without notice.
> However, breaking changes will always be introduced with a version change and/or prior
> communication from the support team. Please reach out to your point of contact at Gem to provide
> feedback.


# Authentication

All requests to Gem API is authenticated with your team's API key. Team admins can provision API
keys on your team's [admin dashboard ("Team Settings")](https://www.gem.com/admin). The API key will
be a 40-character alphanumeric string and should be passed under the header `X-API-Key`. As an
example:

    curl -X GET \
        -H "X-API-Key: <YOUR_API_KEY>" \
        -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
        https://api.gem.com/v0/users

Note: If you are using an integration partner, you will also need to pass the `X-Application-Secret`
header.

# Rate Limits

By default, each API key is subject to a rate limit of 20 requests per second, with a burst
capacity of 500 requests. If you exceed either of these limits, you will receive a `429 Too Many
Requests` or `Limit Exceeded` error code.


# Pagination

Pagination is supported on `GET` requests to collection resources by using `page` and `page_size`
query parameters.

`page` is 1-indexed. `page_size` defaults to 20 if a value isn't provided and the maximum allowed
value is 100. As an example:

    curl -i -X GET \
        -H "X-API-Key: <YOUR_API_KEY>" \
        -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
        https://api.gem.com/v0/users?page=2&page_size=10

Responses from paginated collection resources, even if pagination parameters were not explicitly
defined, will include a `X-Pagination` response header with a JSON object in this shape:

    {
        "total": 176,
        "total_pages": 18,
        "first_page": 1,
        "last_page": 18,
        "page": 2,
        "previous_page": 1,
        "next_page": 3
    }
info.title: Gem API

name.description: The name of the custom field is unique in its scope. Any leading and trailing spaces of the name string will be removed.

scope.description: Custom fields under `team` scope apply to all candidates. Custom fields under `project` scope apply to candidates in a specific project.

project_id.description: Applicable and required when `scope` is `project`. If the custom field has `project` scope, this is the project ID that its associated with.

value_type.description: When `value_type` is `text`, `value` is a string. When `value_type` is `date`, `value` is a string of format `yyyy-mm-dd`. When `value_type` is `single_select`, `value` is a string of an option value. When `value_type` is `multi_select`, `value` is an array of strings of option values.

items.description: Only applicable when `value_type` is one of (`single_select`, `multi_select`). The option ids of the value.

custom_field_category.description: Deprecated: same as `name`. Will be dropped in future versions.

custom_field_value.description: Deprecated: same as `value`. Will be dropped in future versions.

custom_fields.description: Custom fields containing the associated values for the candidate.

project_ids.description: Containing the ids of the projects the candidate is in.

value.description: Contains the new value of the custom field. When `value_type` is `text`, `value` is a string. When `value_type` is `date`, `value` is a string of format `yyyy-mm-dd`. When `value_type` is `single_select`, `value` is a string of the selected option id. When `value_type` is `multi_select`, `value` is an array of strings of selected option ids. Set `value` to `null` to clear `text`, `date`, `single_select` custom fields. Set `value` to an empty array to clear `multi_select` custom fields.

linked_in_handle.description: If `linked_in_handle` is provided, candidate creation will be de-duplicated. If a candidate with the provided `linked_in_handle` already exists, a 400 error will be returned with `errors` containing information on the existing candidate in this shape: `{"errors": { "duplicate_candidate": { "id": "string", "linked_in_handle": "string" }}}`.

profile_urls.description: If `profile_urls` is provided with an array of urls, social `profiles` will be generated based on the provided urls and attached to the candidate.

project_ids.description: If `project_ids` is provided with an array of project ids, the candidate will be added into the projects once they are created.

custom_fields.description: Array of objects containing new custom field values. Only custom fields specified in the array are updated. Click the arrow on the left to find more info about the object.

autofill.description: Requires `linked_in_handle` to be non-null. Attempts to fill in any missing fields.

profile_urls.description: If `profile_urls` is provided with an array of urls, social `profiles` will be replaced with new profiles based on the provided urls.

custom_fields.description: Array of objects containing custom field values to be updated for the candidate. Only custom fields specified in the array are updated. Click the arrow on the left to find more info about the object.

permanently_remove_contact_info.description: Prevent the deleted candidate's contact info from being added back to Gem

resume_file.description: Allowed formats are: .pdf, .doc, .docx. File size cannot exceed 10MB.

is_hidden.description: `hidden` options are not selectable in the Gem product. Candidate custom field values with `hidden` options are not returned when making a query to the Candidates endpoint.

value_type.description: When `value_type` is `text`, `value` is a string. When `value_type` is `date`, `value` is a string of format `yyyy-mm-dd`. When `value_type` is `single_select`, `value` is a string of an option value. When `value_type` is `multi_select`, `value` is an array of strings of option values.

scope.description: Custom fields under `team` scope apply to all candidates. Custom fields under `project` scope apply to candidates in a specific project.

project_id.description: If the custom field has `project` scope, this is the project ID that its associated with.

is_hidden.description: `hidden` custom fields in the candidate info are not displayed in the Gem product or not returned when making a query on the Candidates endpoint.

name.description: The name of the custom field is unique in its scope. Any leading and trailing spaces of the name string will be removed.

value_type.description: When `value_type` is `text`, `value` is a string. When `value_type` is `date`, `value` is a string of format `yyyy-mm-dd`. When `value_type` is `single_select`, `value` is a string of an option value. When `value_type` is `multi_select`, `value` is an array of strings of option values.

scope.description: Custom fields under `team` scope apply to all candidates. Custom fields under `project` scope apply to candidates in a specific project.

project_id.description: Applicable and required when `scope` is `project`. If the custom field has `project` scope, this is the project ID that its associated with.

option_values.description: Applicable and required when `value_type` is one of (`single_select`, `multi_select`).

name.description: The name of the custom field is unique in its scope. Any leading and trailing spaces of the name string will be removed.

is_hidden.description: `hidden` custom fields in the candidate info are not displayed in the Gem product or not returned when making a query on the Candidates endpoint.

option_values.description: An array of new option values to be created. Any leading and trailing spaces of the new option values will be removed.

is_hidden.description: `hidden` options are not selectable in the Gem product. Candidate custom field values with `hidden` options are not returned when making a query to the Candidates endpoint.

files.description: File information associated with the export.

name.description: The name of the project field is unique in its scope.

value_type.description: When `value_type` is `text`, `value` is a string. When `value_type` is `single_select`, `value` is a string of an option value. When `value_type` is `multi_select`, `value` is an array of strings of option values.

items.description: Only applicable when `value_type` is one of (`single_select`, `multi_select`). The option ids of the value.

user_id.description: The user id of the project owner.

project_fields.description: Project fields containing the associated values for the project.

context.description: Summary of top project fields for a project

user_id.description: The user id of the project owner.

project_fields.description: Project fields containing the associated values for the project.

context.description: Summary of top project fields for a project

user_id.description: The user id of the project owner.
User performing the update. If included, the user must have write access to the project.

is_hidden.description: When `is_hidden` is `true`, field options are not displayed in the Gem product, nor are they returned when making a query on the Projects endpoint.

name.description: The name of the project field.

field_type.description: The type of the project field. Options are `text`, `single_select`, or `multi_select`.

user_id.description: The user id of the admin creating the project field.

options.description: The options of the project field. Only applicable when `value_type` is one of (`single_select`, `multi_select`).

is_hidden.description: When `is_hidden` is `true`, project fields are not displayed in the Gem product, nor are they returned when making a query on the Projects endpoint.

name.description: The name of the project field to create. Must differ from existing project field names.

field_type.description: The type of the project field. Options are `text`, `single_select`, or `multi_select`.

options.description: The options of the project field.Only applicable when `value_type` is one of (`single_select`, `multi_select`).

name.description: The name of the project field. Must be unique across entire team.

is_hidden.description: When `is_hidden` is `true`, field options are not displayed in the Gem product, nor are they returned when making a query on the Projects endpoint.

option_id.description: The id of the project field option. Only applicable when `value_type` is one of (`single_select`, `multi_select`).

text.description: The text of the project field. Only applicable when `value_type` is `text`.

field_type.description: The type of the project field. Options are `text`, `single_select`, or `multi_select`.

is_hidden.description: When `is_hidden` is `true`, field options are not displayed in the Gem product, nor are they returned when making a query on the Projects endpoint.

operation.description: Specifies the operation on project field options: `add` or `remove`. For `remove` operations on `single_select` or `text` fields, `options` is not required. For `multi_select`, specify option values to remove.

options.description: List of option id values. Required for `add` operations on `single_select` and `multi_select` fields. For `remove` on `multi_select`, include values to be removed.

text.description: The text of the project field. Required for `add` operations on `text` fields.

options.description: Only applicable when `value_type` is one of (`single_select`, `multi_select`). An array of new option values to be created.

is_hidden.description: When `is_hidden` is `true`, field options are not displayed in the Gem product, nor are they returned when making a query on the Projects endpoint.

user_id.description: The user id of the sequence owner.

get.description: Returns a list of all users on the team and supports pagination.

parameters.name: created_by
parameters.description: the id of the user who adds the candidate into Gem

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: If `email` is provided, the candidates whose email addresses contain `email` will be returned.

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description:
If `updated_after` is provided, only the candidates updated after the
            provided timestamp will be returned. Please provide a Unix timestamp in seconds.

parameters.name: updated_before
parameters.description:
If `updated_before` is provided, only the candidates updated before the
            provided timestamp will be returned. Please provide a Unix timestamp in seconds.

parameters.name: candidate_ids
parameters.description:
If `candidate_ids` is provided, only the candidates with a provided ID
        will be returned. Please provide a comma-separated string. e.g.: candidate_ids=123,456,789.
        A maximum of 20 candidate_ids can be provided.

get.description:
Returns a list of all candidates on the team and supports pagination and search parameters
`created_after`, `created_before`.

post.description: Returns the newly created candidate object.

get.description: Returns the candidate object with the corresponding ID.

put.description:
Modifies a candidate based on ID. Only the fields included in the request argument will be
modified.

delete.description: Deletes a candidate based on ID.

get.summary:
List candidate events (DEPRECATED).
This API is deprecated.
get.description:
Returns a list of all events for the given candidate and supports pagination and search
parameters `created_after`, `created_before`.

post.description:
Returns the newly created event object.
**NOTE**: only `manual_touchpoints` type event can be created currently.

get.description: Returns the event object with the corresponding candidate ID and event ID.

delete.description:
Deletes an event by its ID.
**NOTE**: only `manual_touchpoints` events can be deleted currently.

get.summary:
List candidate events (DEPRECATED).
This API is deprecated.
get.description:
Returns a list of all events for all candidates and supports pagination and search
parameters `created_after`, `created_before`.

get.summary: List notes that belong to a candidate
get.description:
Returns a list of note objects on the given candidate and supports pagination and search
parameters `created_after`, `created_before`.

get.summary: List uploaded resumes for a candidate
get.description:
Returns a list of all resumes uploaded for the candidate
given the candidate ID. Resumes can be downloaded through the `download_url`.
Not all resumes have `filename` stored.

post.description:
NOTE: Besides `candidate_id`, you also need to specify `user_id` in the path to indicate which user
is uploading the resume.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Custom fields under `team` scope apply to all candidates. Custom fields under `project` scope apply to candidates in a specific project.

parameters.name: is_hidden
parameters.description: `hidden` custom fields in the candidate info are not displayed in the Gem product or not returned when making a query on the Candidates endpoint.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Any leading and trailing spaces of the name string will be removed.

get.description:
Returns a list of all custom fields. Supports pagination
and search parameters `created_after`, `created_before`.
Returns the custom field object with the corresponding ID.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Value of an option in the custom field. Any leading and trailing spaces of the option value will be removed.

parameters.name: is_hidden
parameters.description: `hidden` options are not selectable in the Gem product. Candidate custom field values with `hidden` options are not returned when making a query to the Candidates endpoint.

get.summary: List options in a custom field
get.description:
Returns a list of all custom fields options in a `single_select` or `multi_select`
custom field.

post.summary: Add options to a custom field

get.summary: Get an option in a custom field
get.description:
Returns an option in a `single_select` or `multi_select`
custom field.

patch.summary: Modify an option in a custom field
patch.description:
Returns an option in a `single_select` or `multi_select`
custom field.

Custom Field Option cannot be deleted and can only be hidden.

get.summary: Get the most recent data export.
get.description: Returns the data export information for the most recent export.

post.description: Returns the newly created note object.

get.description: Returns the note object with the note ID.

delete.description: Deletes a note by its ID.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: List all projects owned by this user.

parameters.name: readable_by
parameters.description: List all projects that this user has read access to.

parameters.name: writable_by
parameters.description: List all projects that this user has write access to, that is,                    all the projects that this user can add/remove candidates

get.description:
Returns a list of all projects on the team and supports pagination
and search parameters `created_after`, `created_before`.

post.description: Returns the newly created project object.

get.description: Returns the project object with the corresponding ID

patch.description:
Modifies a project based on ID. Only the fields included in the request
argument will be modified.

get.description:
Returns a list of all candidates in the project given the project_id. Supports
search parameters `added_after`, `added_before`.

This endpoint allows fetching the membership log for a project or candidate.
At least one filter (`project_id` or `candidate_id`) must be specified.

parameters.name: is_hidden
parameters.description: Hidden project fields in projects are not displayed in the Gem product, nor are they returned when making a query on the Projects endpoint.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the project field.

parameters.name: field_type
parameters.description: Specifies the project field type. For `text`, the value is a string. For `single_select`, the value is a string representing a selected option. For `multi_select`, the value is an array of strings, each representing a selected option.

get.description:
Returns a list of all project fields.
Supports pagination and search parameters `created_after`, `created_before`.
Returns a project field with the coresponding id.

patch.description: Update a project field with the corresponding id.

get.description: Returns a list of all options of a project field.

post.description: Add a project field option to a project field.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value of the project field option.

parameters.name: is_hidden
parameters.description: When `is_hidden` is `true`, field options are not displayed in the Gem product, nor are they returned when making a query on the Projects endpoint.

get.summary: List options in a project field
get.description:
Returns a list of all project fields options in a `single_select` or `multi_select`
project field.

post.description: Creates a new project field option.

get.description: Returns a project field option by ID.

patch.description: Updates a project field option's visibility by ID.

get.description: Returns a list of sequences that match all of the provided search criteria.
Returns the sequence object with the corresponding ID.

tags.name: Candidate Uploaded Resumes
tags.description: Operations on resumes uploaded for candidates

tags.name: Custom Fields
tags.description: Operations on custom fields. Custom fields cannot be removed and only can be hidden. Mutations on the custom field values associated with candidates are performed on the Candidates endpoint.

tags.name: Custom Field Options
tags.description: Operations on options in `single_select` and `multiple_select` custom fields. Options cannot be deleted and only can be hidden.

tags.name: Project and Candidates Membership
tags.description: Operations on managing candidates in a project

tags.name: Project Fields
tags.description: Operations on project fields. Project fields cannot be removed and can only be hidden. Mutations on the field values associated with projects are performed on the Projects endpoint.

tags.name: Project Field Options Associations
tags.description: Manage project field options across all types, including `single_select`, `multiple_select`, and `text`. Supports adding or removing option values to/from project fields, facilitating dynamic updates to project configurations.

tags.name: Project Field Options
tags.description: Operations on options in `single_select` and `multiple_select` project fields. Options cannot be deleted and only can be hidden.
